'''Affirmative action''' commonly refers to taking action to ensure [[diversity]] in a work environment. It can refer to anything from [[equal opportunity]] hiring practices to practices that actually prefer [[minority|minorities]], such as [[racial quota]]s and lowered standards for minority applicants. Some claim that racial preferences have in effect caused a [[reverse discrimination]] against the traditional majority (white males in Europe and North America) and liken such preferences to [[apartheid]].
''This is a stub. Those who have worked in human resources should know more and are invited to [[Wikipedia utilities/find or fix a stub|fix it]].''
